title: On evaluation of integrals involving Bessel functions

title_detail.value: On evaluation of integrals involving Bessel functions

summary:
We introduce a symbolic method for the evaluation of definite integrals
containing combinations of various functions, including exponentials, logarithm
and products of Bessel functions of different types. The method we develop is
naturally suited for the evaluation of integrals associated with specific
Feynman diagrams.

Abstract
We introduce a symbolic method for the evaluation of definite integrals containing combinations
of various functions, including exponentials, logarithm and products of Bessel functions of different
types. The method we develop is naturally suited for the evaluation of integrals associated with
specific Feynman diagrams.

II.

INTEGRALS INVOLVING BESSEL FUNCTIONS

In this section, in order to fix the main results which will be exploited in the second
part of the paper, we will derive old and new integrals involving Bessel-type functions. The
starting point will be the general procedure put forward in Ref. [4] to treat the integrals
of Bessel functions. The technique is fairly efficient and straightforward and benefits from
the fact that, as already remarked, Bessel functions can formally be treated as elementary
functions.
